column4: did you use the alternate adition to install your raid system,  it seems to guide you through what can and can't do
so setup using the desktop edition?
if not much to loose sometimes easier just to reinstall
trial and error is alot of work,  install is about 30 min
ok so what does sudo fdisk -l look like now then
done the command, i got 2 drives listed, top (the 1 i want) has 3 partitians sda1 has * under Boot
try install rfkill and see what it see's
also look in bios boot see if wifi is visable there
yes got you confused with rsv when you didn't  add anything about the subject sorry
well I don't see any info about a raid install,  what you gave me just says you have 3 partitions
what file format are they?  can you mount them from a live cd boot?
from a live cd you can't mount read write?
so what is your plan?  mount the raid disk partitions,  move them to a none raid partitions setup grub2 to point to the new disks and be done with it?
oh I don't think grub-legacy will boot from a raid device but grub2 will, so that may have been where some of your problems started
opps forgot the sudo in mount also
